intro: Pteracanthus duclouxii, commonly known as the Ducloux's pteracanthus, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
